description: The Royal Armouries Museum in Leeds houses one of the world's most impressive collections of arms and armor. From medieval knights to samurai warriors, the exhibits span centuries of military history across cultures.
A winter stroll through Leeds city centre. Victorian architecture meets modern commerce in this vibrant northern English city.
The National Railway Museum in York — one of the world's largest railway museums. From steam locomotives to modern high-speed trains, celebrating two centuries of British rail heritage.
A rare heavy snowfall transformed Paris into a winter wonderland. The city's iconic streets and rooftops blanketed in white, creating scenes of quiet beauty amid the usual bustle.

location: Paris The Hôtel National des Invalides
description: The Hôtel National des Invalides, originally built as a hospital for wounded soldiers, now houses Napoleon's tomb and the Army Museum. Its golden dome stands as one of Paris's most recognizable landmarks.
The Louvre, Paris — home to the Mona Lisa and countless masterpieces. A treasure trove of art spanning millennia, from ancient Egyptian artifacts to Renaissance paintings.
Quiet moments at home in Paris. The warmth of indoor life contrasts with the winter city outside, capturing the simple pleasures of daily living in the City of Light.
Belfast continued. The Titanic Quarter's modern development stands where the great ship was built, a symbol of the city's transformation.
Belfast, the capital of Northern Ireland, where Victorian architecture meets modern regeneration. The city's rich maritime heritage and complex history create a compelling urban landscape.
More of Edinburgh's splendor. The Royal Mile descends from castle to palace, while the New Town's Georgian elegance unfolds below.

Edinburgh, Scotland's historic capital, where medieval Old Town and Georgian New Town create a dramatic cityscape. The castle perched on volcanic rock watches over centuries of architectural splendor.
Manchester, the heart of England's industrial revolution, now reinvented as a vibrant cultural hub. Red brick warehouses stand alongside modern architecture in this ever-evolving northern city.
More of Oxford's treasures. The Bodleian Library, Radcliffe Camera, and the quiet quadrangles where great minds have walked for centuries.
Oxford, the city of dreaming spires. Nearly a thousand years of scholarship have shaped this architectural wonder where ancient colleges line cobbled lanes.
Whitby's 199 steps and beyond. From the abbey ruins to the fish and chips, this town captures the essence of the Yorkshire coast.
Whitby, the atmospheric harbor town that inspired Bram Stoker's Dracula. The ruined abbey watches over fishing boats and winding streets of this North Yorkshire gem.
More of Saltburn's coastal charm. Dramatic cliffs meet golden sands in this unspoiled corner of England.
Saltburn-by-the-Sea, a Victorian resort town on the North Yorkshire coast. The historic pier and cliff lift stand as monuments to seaside elegance.
The British Museum, housing treasures from every corner of human civilization. From the Rosetta Stone to the Parthenon Marbles, history unfolds across continents and millennia.
London at twilight. The city lights up as day turns to night along the Thames.
London's neighborhoods and hidden gems. From Covent Garden's performers to Notting Hill's colorful houses.
Historic London. Westminster's Gothic towers, Whitehall's government buildings, and the changing of the guard.
The South Bank and beyond. Modern architecture along the Thames, with St Paul's dome watching from across the river.
London, a world capital where centuries of history meet contemporary culture. From royal palaces to street markets, the city pulses with endless energy.
Valleys and waterfalls. The raw power of Welsh nature carved into ancient rock.
Rural Wales at its finest. Stone walls crisscross green hillsides where farming traditions endure.
The wild beauty of the Welsh coast. Dramatic cliffs, hidden coves, and the ever-changing Irish Sea.
Mountain railways and seaside towns. The heritage of Welsh industry meets Victorian resort elegance.
Welsh castles and coastal villages. Edward I's iron ring of fortresses still guards the landscape after seven centuries.
Exploring Snowdonia National Park. Rugged terrain where slate quarries and sheep farms dot the mountainsides.
North Wales, a land of dramatic mountains, ancient castles, and the lyrical Welsh language. Snowdonia's peaks rise above valleys steeped in Celtic legend.
A final look at Chatsworth. The estate's timeless beauty captured in autumn's golden light.
Chatsworth's grounds and deer park. Wild fallow deer roam freely where nature and aristocratic taste have merged for generations.
The gardens of Chatsworth. Cascading fountains, ancient trees, and landscapes designed by Capability Brown.
Inside Chatsworth House. Painted ceilings, old master paintings, and rooms that have hosted royalty for centuries.
Chatsworth House, the magnificent Derbyshire estate of the Duke of Devonshire. Baroque grandeur set against the rolling hills of the Peak District.
The colleges of Cambridge. King's College Chapel, Trinity's Great Court, and the quiet beauty of the Backs along the River Cam.
Cambridge, where eight centuries of academic excellence have shaped one of the world's most beautiful university towns. Punts glide beneath bridges as scholars cycle past ancient colleges.
Final moments in York. The city walls at sunset, offering panoramic views of this timeless English gem.
More treasures of York. Hidden courtyards, ancient pubs, and the gentle flow of the River Ouse through the city center.
York Minster and its surroundings. Gothic architecture reaching skyward, a testament to centuries of faith and craftsmanship.
Wandering through York's Shambles. This narrow medieval street, once home to butchers, now charms visitors with its leaning timber frames.
York, England's best-preserved medieval city. Ancient walls encircle a labyrinth of cobbled streets where history breathes in every stone.
Dubai after dark. The city transforms into a glittering spectacle of lights reflected in glass and water.
Exploring Dubai's urban landscape. The contrast between gleaming towers and traditional souks tells the story of rapid transformation.
Dubai, where futuristic architecture rises from the desert. A city of superlatives pushing the boundaries of what's possible.
Final captures from ChinaJoy. The intersection of technology and art, where virtual worlds meet real-world enthusiasm.
More moments from ChinaJoy. Elaborate booth displays, passionate fans, and the creative energy that defines this annual gaming festival.
ChinaJoy, Asia's largest gaming and digital entertainment expo in Shanghai. A vibrant celebration of gaming culture, cosplay, and cutting-edge technology.

description: The Ming Xiaoling Sacred Way. Ancient stone guardians line the path to the imperial tomb, where elephants, camels, and mythical creatures stand watch for six centuries.

description: Final moments on Zijin Shan. The mountain's forested trails connect centuries of Chinese history, from Ming emperors to Republican revolutionaries.

description: Meiling Palace and Linggu Temple. The Republican-era villa of Chiang Kai-shek and Soong Mei-ling sits near the ancient Buddhist temple with its beamless hall.

description: Nanjing's sacred mountain, Zijin Shan. The Sun Yat-sen Mausoleum honors the founding father of modern China, while the Ming Xiaoling Mausoleum marks the tomb of the dynasty's first emperor.
Returning to Xuanwu Lake in autumn. The willows turn golden and the ancient city wall reflects on peaceful waters.
Dali's art scene and café culture. A new generation of artists and dreamers has made this their home.
Erhai Lake, the jewel of Dali. Villages dot the shoreline where fishermen still use traditional cormorants.
The ancient city walls and gates of Dali. Bai minority architecture blends with centuries of trade route history.
Dali, the ancient Bai kingdom on Erhai Lake. Three Pagodas stand against the Cangshan Mountains in this laid-back traveler's haven.
Yulong Snow Mountain, the dragon that never melts. Glaciers and alpine meadows tower above Lijiang at over 5,000 meters.
Songzanlin Monastery, the Little Potala of Yunnan. Tibetan Buddhist traditions flourish at 3,300 meters elevation.
Shangri-La, the legendary paradise on the Tibetan plateau. High-altitude monasteries and yak herders in a land that inspired James Hilton's novel.
Final moments in Lijiang. Where Yunnan's ethnic diversity creates a cultural tapestry unlike anywhere else.
Black Dragon Pool and Mu's Residence. Lijiang's most photographed views reflect centuries of local history.
Lijiang at dusk. The old town comes alive with lantern light and traditional music.
Views of Jade Dragon Snow Mountain. The sacred peak of the Naxi people watches over the ancient town.
The old town's maze of lanes. Red lanterns, stone bridges, and the Naxi culture that has thrived here for centuries.
Lijiang, the ancient Naxi town at the foot of Jade Dragon Snow Mountain. UNESCO-listed streets where water channels flow past wooden houses.
Farewell to Guangzhou. The subtropical energy of South China lingers in memory.
Canton Tower and the Pearl River. Modern Guangzhou glitters along the waterfront after dark.
Dim sum and Cantonese delicacies. The birthplace of yum cha tradition serves the finest morning tea in China.
The historic Shamian Island and Chen Clan Ancestral Hall. Colonial architecture and traditional Lingnan culture preserved in the city center.
Guangzhou, the southern gateway to China. Canton's trading heritage blends with modern skyscrapers and legendary Cantonese cuisine.
Fireworks over Enchanted Storybook Castle. Shanghai Disney's spectacular finale lights up the night sky.
Rides, parades, and themed lands. The immersive experiences that make the Disney parks magical.
Shanghai Disneyland, where Disney magic meets Chinese culture. The world's newest Disney castle in Asia's most exciting city.
Lhasa at altitude. Prayer flags flutter, yak butter lamps glow, and the thin air carries ancient mantras.
Sera and Drepung monasteries. The great seats of learning where Buddhist philosophy has been debated for centuries.
Inside the Potala Palace. The Dalai Lamas' former winter residence holds centuries of Buddhist art and sacred relics.
The Jokhang Temple and Barkhor Street. Pilgrims prostrate themselves on the circuit around Tibet's holiest shrine.
Lhasa, the sacred city on the roof of the world. The Potala Palace rises above a land where spirituality permeates every aspect of life.
Final treasures from the Egypt exhibition. Two civilizations meet as Chinese visitors encounter the wonders of the pharaohs.
The Book of the Dead and other papyri. Ancient spells meant to guide souls through the afterlife.
Daily life in ancient Egypt. Jewelry, cosmetics, and tools that reveal how ordinary people lived millennia ago.
Gods and pharaohs. Statues and reliefs that once adorned temples along the Nile.
Royal artifacts and funerary objects. The Egyptian obsession with eternal life preserved in gold and stone.
Ancient Egypt comes to Shanghai. Mummies, hieroglyphics, and treasures from the Nile Valley in a special exhibition at Shanghai Museum.
Wukang Road, Shanghai's most picturesque lane. French Plane trees arch over art deco mansions where history whispers from every doorway.

description: A farewell to Giverny. The painter's garden immortalized in brushstrokes, now viewed along Shanghai's historic waterfront.

location: Shanghai The Bund No. 1 Impressionist Painting Exhibition Monet
folder: 20210731-Shanghai The Bund No. 1 Impressionist Painting Exhibition Monet

description: Monet and the Impressionists at Bund One. Original masterpieces from Musée Marmottan Monet brought to Shanghai.
Final moments at the museum. Where Shanghai's artistic ambitions reach toward the future.
Sculpture gardens and outdoor installations. Art extends beyond gallery walls to embrace the city skyline.
The museum architecture itself as art. Light, space, and the Huangpu River views create their own exhibition.
Photography and mixed media works. The boundaries between traditional and contemporary blur.
Large-scale installations and immersive exhibits. Art that transforms space and perception.
Exploring the museum's collection. International and Chinese contemporary art in dialogue.
Shanghai Museum of Art Pudong, the city's newest art landmark. Contemporary galleries in a striking waterfront building.
Views of the Giant Buddha from the river and surrounding hillsides. The sheer scale defies comprehension even in person.
The Leshan Giant Buddha, the world's largest stone Buddha. Carved into a cliff face where three rivers meet, it has watched over the waters for 1,200 years.
Higher on Mount Emei. Through bamboo forests and past Buddhist shrines toward the golden summit.
Mount Emei, one of China's four sacred Buddhist mountains. Misty peaks, ancient temples, and mischievous monkeys along the pilgrimage path.
Wuhou Temple, dedicated to the legendary strategist Zhuge Liang. The Three Kingdoms heritage site in the heart of Chengdu.
Final treasures from Sanxingdui. Questions remain unanswered about the people who created these remarkable artifacts.
Jade and bronze ritual vessels. The spiritual world of ancient Shu civilization revealed through extraordinary craftsmanship.
Gold masks and bronze trees. The sacred objects of a kingdom that vanished without a written record.
The extraordinary bronze heads of Sanxingdui. Enigmatic faces from 3,000 years ago that challenge our understanding of ancient China.
Sanxingdui Museum, home to one of archaeology's greatest mysteries. Bronze masks and golden artifacts from a civilization lost to history.
More Sichuan delicacies. From mapo tofu to dan dan noodles, each dish tells the story of a fearless culinary tradition.
The flavors of Sichuan. Numbing peppercorns, fiery chilies, and the bold cuisine that defines Chengdu's culinary identity.
Dujiangyan Irrigation System, a 2,300-year-old engineering marvel. Ancient hydraulics that still water the Chengdu Plain today.
Chengdu Research Base of Giant Panda Breeding. China's beloved national treasures in their bamboo-filled sanctuary.
A city walk through Shanghai. Art deco facades, shikumen lanes, and the endless energy of China's most cosmopolitan metropolis.
The folk arts hall. Traditional crafts, shadow puppets, and the living heritage of Chinese culture.
The Republic of China history gallery. Nanjing's role as the nationalist capital comes alive through photographs and artifacts.
Paintings, calligraphy, and textile arts. The artistic heritage of imperial China preserved for generations.
Ancient bronzes and ceramics. The museum's archaeological collection reveals the rich history of the Jiangsu region.
Nanjing Museum, one of China's three great museums. Collections span from prehistoric jade to Ming dynasty treasures.
Evening at the Qinhuai River. Historic boats and illuminated temples reflect on waters that have inspired poets for millennia.
The surrounding Confucius Temple district. Lanterns and traditional architecture along the Qinhuai River.
Artifacts and exhibits of the imperial examination system. Calligraphy, documents, and the tools of scholarly ambition.
Inside the examination halls. Rows of tiny cells where candidates spent days writing essays that would determine their fate.
The Nanjing Imperial Examination Museum at Jiangnan Examination Hall. For centuries, scholars competed here for positions in the imperial bureaucracy.
Shanghai's café culture. The city's vibrant coffee scene blends international sophistication with local charm in hidden lane houses and sleek storefronts.
First impressions of Beijing. The capital city where ancient imperial grandeur meets modern ambition.
The romantic railway track in Nanjing, a beloved spot where old rail lines have become a scenic walkway through the city's greenery.
Xuanwu Lake, Nanjing's urban oasis. The ancient lake surrounded by the Ming city wall offers peaceful respite in the heart of the city.
Nanjing Normal University, one of China's oldest teacher training institutions. The campus blends Republican-era architecture with modern academic buildings.
